content.description: After rappelling down the entire rope length I climbed back up sustained (5.5) face with horizontal breaks filled with small blueberry twig bushes. After the long face climb to the base of the 50ft. overlap sloping down on its north side is reached. Crux is getting onto the height of the overlap. From there on out its slightly easier as an outside corner face climb. Incredible ambiance being in the area of multiple slides to the west of this slide.
content.protection: None but it'll take pro and that would be mainly angle pitons and maybe cams at the start to the overlap. I soloed it and kept the rope close at hand in case of an emergency.
content.location: Can be seen from the tourist pullout parking spot to view Mount Osceola on the Kangmagus Highway to get your bearing to where the top of the slide is located. It's your usual 4 to 5000 footer bushwhack from the summit north to find the slide. A bit dangerous bushwhacking because it is hard see where the drop offs begin to where the forest ends.

content.description: Rappel a whole rope length on the slides north side beginning down a large over laps outside corner face and then proceed nearly to the slide's base. Actual bottom of slide is filthy. Then climb back up. The east side of the summit has a 60+ft. wall that would have some descent face climbing potential but you'd have to deal with at it's base the remains of a large steel fire tower the W.M.N.F. dropped off the summit to rot below this ledge.
